conclusion: Understanding the relationship between the light source, objects, and shadows.
Shadow A of the apple is cast to the right and slightly forward.
Shadow B of the white paper is cast to the right and slightly forward.
Shadow C of the glass is cast to the left and slightly forward.
Shadow D of the chicken leg is cast to the left and slightly forward.
Light source is from the front left.
Light source moves to the back right.
Shadows will be cast in the opposite direction relative to the new light source position.
Shadow A of the apple will be cast to the left and slightly backward.
Shadow B of the white paper will be cast to the left and slightly backward.
Shadow C of the glass will be cast to the right and slightly backward.
Shadow D of the chicken leg will be cast to the right and slightly backward.
Conclusion that shadows A, B, C, and D will change position.
Final answer: A and B will be cast to the left and slightly backward; C and D will be cast to the right and slightly backward.
